newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sees decision soon on coffee council.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sees decision soon on coffee council.

text.p: Brazil's Ministry of Industry and Commerce is in the final stages of studying the creation of a new coffee council and a decision should be announced soon, said a senior commodities official.
Mauricio Assis, head of the ministry's primary commodities department, told Reuters the study was well-advanced but he could not say exactly when a decision would be made.
"The proposal is being studied and a decision is imminent," he said.
The new council, to include both private and public sector representatives, will decide future Brazilian coffee policy. Its creation was suggested by a parliamentary committee.

The head of the lower house committee, Deputy Carlos Melles, has said he expected a decision by September 7. Melles was due to meet Industry and Commerce Minister Francisco Dornelles Wednesday afternoon, an aide said.
Last month, Dornelles said he gave his wholehearted support to the establishment of such a council.
